Generation VII.Sun: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
Generation VII.Moon: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It will never show an enemy its back in battle. Ancient warriors liked Jangmo-o for its valiant disposition and made it one of their own.

Generation VIII.Sword: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.
Generation VIII.Shield: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that's become as hard as metal.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The scale atop its head is useful for both offense and defense. It bravely stands and faces its foes rather than turning tail, even if its foes are strong.
Generation IX.Violet: They communicate with their allies using the sounds their scales make when struck. A group of these Pokémon causes quite a racket.

Generation VIII.Sword: Lake of Outrage Axew's Eye , Rolling Fields ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Sword Expansion Pass: Challenge Road , Potbottom Desert Challenge Road ( Wanderer ) Loop Lagoon ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Wistful Fields , Paradise Barrens , Kitakami Wilds Tera Raid Battles ( 3★ )
